name: Life of Bo
description:
An ape called Bo starts to wander around the savanna where a tree offers him fruits.

Bo enjoys the gifts of nature.

Below the shadow of a second tree, he is able to communicate with his mates.

After venturing to yet another tree struck by lighting, he finds a burning stick from which he makes a campfire.

He sits down by the fire whilst everything changes, including him.
Bono stands up and starts walking in a narrow canyon where at first he collects berries, then he encounters a hut where gets a spear, with which he kills a bull.  

Bono then plants a seed from which wheat grows while he sits down to watch nature run its course.

Eventually, from all that he has planted, the industrial revolution blooms and this new man, Nono.
Pacing hastens, life speeds up in previously unimaginable manners.

Fast development brings many pleasurable items, but no time to enjoy.
Endless possibilities have brought the sense of continuously being lost while feeling stuck in a loop.

Nono eventually gets into the rhythm of everydays and he can’t stop running.
Until he hits a wall.
